a1: Morse code is a character encoding method using sequences of dots and dashes to represent letters, numbers, and punctuation. It was developed by Samuel Morse for telegraph communication.
q2: How do I separate words in Morse code?
a2: In Morse code, letters are separated by spaces, and words are separated by a forward slash (/). Our tool handles this automatically.
q3: Can I hear the Morse code?
a3: Yes! Click the Play button to hear the Morse code played as audio tones using the Web Audio API.
a4: Yes, the tool supports all letters A-Z, numbers 0-9, and common punctuation including period, comma, question mark, exclamation mark, and more.
